forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 50. South southwest wind 9 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely. Mostly cloudy. High near 57, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. West northwest wind 12 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
Tonight in Downtown San Francisco, the atmosphere is thick with anticipation as rain falls steadily, cloaking the city in a shroud of muted gray. The clouds hang low, painting the skyline with their somber tones, while the brisk south-southwest wind rustles through the streets like whispered secrets. With temperatures hovering around fifty, it feels both cool and cozy—a perfect night for curling up indoors with a good book or sharing stories over warm drinks. The rain is unyielding, promising substantial amounts that may transform the familiar streets into shimmering reflections under the city lights.

As Thursday dawns, expect the clouds to linger nostalgically, allowing only sporadic glimpses of the sun. The day will unfold with a persistent likelihood of rain, gently encouraging denizens to embrace warmth and comfort. Cozy layers will be essential; a sturdy outer shell paired with soft sweaters will keep the chill at bay. Perhaps a relaxed morning spent at a café, indulging in the rich aroma of freshly brewed coffee, will offer the perfect backdrop to this wintry scene. Alternatively, a stroll through the city adorned in its glistening wetness can reveal the beauty hidden in the rain-soaked streets—a chance to reconnect with the quiet charm of a city embracing its seasonal moods.
